Dispute_Type: Unpaid commissions and performance bonus after termination
Legal_Issue: Whether the Referee's decision breached procedural fairness or natural justice principles
Whether the Referee erred in assessing evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Referee found no breach of labour standards; Court found assessment reasonable
Decision_Outcome: No breach of labour standards found by Referee
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate error or unfairness
Credibility_Factor: Referee's evaluation of evidence deemed reasonable
Legal_Rule: Judicial review under Canada Labour Code
Deference to Referee due to privative clause and expertise
Procedural_Issue: Alleged breach of procedural fairness or natural justice
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No violation of procedural fairness found
Legal_Framework: Canada Labour Code, Part III – Protection of Wages
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged Referee's decision on procedural fairness and evidence assessment
Court_Result: Judicial review application dismissed without costs
Defendant_Response: Likely argued compliance with wage obligations under the Code
Remedy_Requested: Payment of unpaid commissions and bonuses
Outcome: Referee's decision upheld; no remedy granted
Legal_Provision: Sections of Canada Labour Code relating to wage protection and dispute resolution
Authority: Canada Industrial Relations Board (or designated Referee)
Legal_Provision_Cited: Canada Labour Code provisions on unpaid wages and bonuses
Jurisdiction: Federal jurisdiction under Canada Labour Code
Governing_Rule: Canada Labour Code, standard of review principles from administrative law
